Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the image of the Nigerian president giving an unprotected handshake while wearing a face mask is doctored. The original photo does not include face masks.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a manipulated image that has been debunked by experts.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the Nigerian president is not aware of precautionary measures against the spread of the virus, without providing evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation exists for the image, which is that it was manipulated to add face masks to the Nigerian president and another individual in the photo.
Exaggerate: The claim may be seen as exaggerating the situation by suggesting that the Nigerian president is not following precautionary measures, when in reality, the image is doctored.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating bias in the claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times bias in the claim.
